intro: Queltia × parkinsonii, commonly known as the Parkinson's queltia, is a hybrid plant species resulting from the cross between Queltia glabra and Queltia paniculata. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, pendulous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in warm, humid climates. It features heart-shaped leaves and a woody stem, making it an attractive ornamental plant. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a range of morphological variations depending on its genetic background.
